body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>

/kind bug

> /kind feature


**What happened**:

I created a static pod for etcd as following with vsphere as cloud provider:

```
{
    "apiVersion": "v1",
    "kind": "Pod",
    "metadata": {
        "name": "k8s-etcd",
        "namespace": "kube-system",
        "annotations": {
            "scheduler.alpha.kubernetes.io/critical-pod": ""
        }
    },
    "spec": {
        "containers": [
            {
                "command": [
                    "etcd",
                    "--name=etcd0",
                    "--data-dir=/var/lib/etcd",
                    "--initial-advertise-peer-urls=https://9.111.255.77:2380",
                    "--listen-peer-urls=https://0.0.0.0:2380",
                    "--listen-client-urls=https://0.0.0.0:4001",
                    "--advertise-client-urls=https://9.111.255.77:4001",
                    "--cert-file=/etc/cfc/conf/etcd/server.pem",
                    "--key-file=/etc/cfc/conf/etcd/server-key.pem",
                    "--client-cert-auth",
                    "--peer-auto-tls",
                    "--trusted-ca-file=/etc/cfc/conf/etcd/ca.pem",
                    "--initial-cluster-token=etcd-cluster-1",
                    "--initial-cluster=etcd0=https://9.111.255.77:2380",
                    "--grpc-keepalive-timeout=0",
                    "--grpc-keepalive-interval=0",
                    "--snapshot-count=10000",
                    "--initial-cluster-state=new"
                ],
                "image": "ibmcom/etcd:v3.2.14",
                "imagePullPolicy": "IfNotPresent",
                "name": "etcd",
                "volumeMounts": [
                    {
                        "mountPath": "/var/lib/etcd",
                        "name": "data"
                    },
                    {
                        "mountPath": "/etc/cfc/conf/etcd",
                        "name": "etcd-certs"
                    }
                ]
            }
        ],
        "hostNetwork": true,
        "volumes": [
            {
                "hostPath": {
                    "path": "/var/lib/etcd"
                },
                "name": "data"
            },
            {
                "hostPath": {
                    "path": "/etc/cfc/conf/etcd"
                },
                "name": "etcd-certs"
            }
        ]
    }
}
```

But the hostname is using upper name, and when kubelet start the etcd static pod, it will report error as follows:
```
Can't process manifest file "/etc/cfc/pods/etcd.json": invalid pod: [metadata.name: Invalid value: "k8s-etcd-ICP-Master": a DNS-1123 subdomain must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character (e.g. 'example.com', regex used for validation is '[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?(\.[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)*') spec.nodeName: Invalid value: "ICP-Master": a DNS-1123 subdomain must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character (e.g. 'example.com', regex used for validation is '[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?(\.[a-z0-9]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])?)*')]
```

I think that the vsphere should not return upper case hostname, but only lower case hostname.


**What you expected to happen**:

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:


**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

title: Cloud Provider should not return upper case hostname
